qas.question: What variety of Islam was Gaddafi raised in?
In what country is Kampala Mosque located?
In what ethnic culture was Gaddafi raised?
In what year did Gaddafi notably visit Italy?

context: Gaddafi's ideological worldview was moulded by his environment, namely his Islamic faith, his <a2_0>Bedouin<a2_0/> upbringing, and his disgust at the actions of European colonialists in Libya. He was driven by a sense of "divine mission", believing himself a conduit of Allah's will, and thought that he must achieve his goals "no matter what the cost". Raised within the <a0_0>Sunni<a0_0/> branch of Islam, Gaddafi called for the implementation of sharia within Libya. He desired unity across the Islamic world, and encouraged the propagation of the faith elsewhere. On a <a3_0>2010<a3_0/> visit to Italy, he paid a modelling agency to find 200 young Italian women for a lecture he gave urging them to convert. He also funded the construction and renovation of two mosques in Africa, including <a1_0>Uganda<a1_0/>'s Kampala Mosque. He nevertheless clashed with conservative Libyan clerics as to his interpretation of Islam. Many criticised his attempts to encourage women to enter traditionally male-only sectors of society, such as the armed forces. Gaddafi was keen to improve women's status, though saw the sexes as "separate but equal" and therefore felt women should usually remain in traditional roles.
